page.title: 01Peak Dale _ An Overview
page.content: Peak Dale is an upland village dominated by the limestone on which it stands. The limestone is a commodity much in demand from industry as a whole. Limestone and limestone products are used in chemical and manufacturing industries as well as in road and house building.Consequently,limestone is quarried extensively. Near the village there are three quarries.The one at Tunstead is just south of the Peak Dale block,but as it has the longest working quarry face in Europe,it dominates the landscape. Many of the people who live in the village work at the quarry and some of them live in houses owned by the company who control the quarry. Other people who live in the village work in Buxton,Chapel_en_le_Frith or New Mills.
